SHORT_DESCR.P: BHC wishes to purchase a new hydraulic material handler, to be used in the unloading and loading of steel coils and scrap. It should also be capable of discharging dry bulk materials (mainly coal and grain) and refuse-derived fuel (RDF) to / from ocean-going vessels.
BHC may, but gives no commitment that it shall, also purchase parts, spares packages, support and/or services from the successful bidder.

BHC wishes to purchase a new hydraulic material handler to be used in the unloading and loading of dry bulk materials (mainly coal and grain), scrap and refuse-derived fuel (RDF) to / from ocean-going vessels.

The material handler must be suitable for use on vessels ranging from 4000 - 36500 tonnes. It must also be capable of discharging steel coils up to a weight of 30 tonnes per coil on the largest ships serviced at the harbor.
The material handler must also be capable of discharging the following commodities at rates of a minimum of 400 tonnes per hour based on the following materials and bulk densities:

As part of the package, various attachments would also be required, namely two bulk handling grabs, an orange peel (scrap) grab, an orange peel grab (for woodchip), an RDF bale grab, steel coil clamp and a hook.

The material handler must also be capable of traveling on roads around the Belfast Harbour estate, the various quays and should have a maximum wheel loading which does not exceed 15 tonnes per wheel. The material handler must be diesel driven.

BHC may, but gives no commitment that it shall, also purchase parts, spares packages, support and / or services from the successful bidder. Further details are available within the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire available at the address specified above.

At the invitation to negotiate stage of this process, shortlisted bidders will be provided with BHC's specific functionality requirements for the material handler, in relation to which bidders will be asked to provide their proven design and demonstrate how the material handler will operate including (if requested by BHC) by way of a site visit at the bidder's cost.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: BHC anticipates entering into a contract with the successful bidder for a minimum 12 month period, however, contract duration may vary depending on the delivery programme and whether / to what extent BHC chooses to exercise the option referred to below at Section II.2.11.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: As set out in the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: BHC may, but gives no commitment that it shall, also purchase spare parts, spares packages, support and / or services from the successful bidder.

INFO_ADD.P: The costs of responding to this notice and participation in the process shall be borne by each bidder. All discussions and correspondence will be deemed strictly subject to contract until a formal contract is entered into.

SUITABILITY.P: As specified in the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire.

DEPOSIT_GUARANTEE_REQUIRED.P: BHC reserves the right to require bonds, deposits, guarantees or other forms of undertaking or security to ensure proper contractual performance.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITION.P: As set out in the tender and contract documentation.

LEGAL_FORM.P: Subject to the status and involvement of the parties, BHC may require the parties to commit to joint and several-liability in respect of the contract. Alternatively, BHC may require the lead organisation to take total responsibility or a consortium to form a legal entity before entering into any contract.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: As set out in the tender and contract documentation.

INFO_ADD.P: This process is being conducted competitively in accordance with the Utilities Contracts Regulations 2016 (as amended). The procedure to be followed for this procurement is the Negotiated Procedure with a prior call for competition (Regulation 47).
Bidders who wish to participate in this procurement are required to provide details of their contact point, together with an email address and telephone number upon downloading the tender documents.
Bidders who fail to provide their details to BHC or register in this manner will not receive any clarifications or updated information provided by BHC during the tender process.

All discussions and correspondence will be deemed strictly subject to contract until a formal contract is entered into. The formal contract shall not be binding until it has been signed and dated by the duly authorised representatives of both parties.

Bidders satisfying the selection criteria at the pre-qualification stage of this process will be afforded the opportunity of a site visit. Bidders may also be required, at the Invitation to Negotiate stage of this process, to demonstrate the operation of a proven material handler supply at their or a customer's premises at their own cost.

Further details will be provided by BHC in due course. Subject to a sufficient number of satisfactory responses being received, a maximum of the top 3 ranked bidders will be invited to negotiate following the selection stage of this process, provided that the Contracting Authority, acting at its discretion, reserves the right to invite less than 3 bidders to negotiate.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: High Court of Justice in Northern Ireland
ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.ADDRESS: Royal Courts of Justice, Chichester Street

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: BHC will incorporate a minimum 10 calendar day standstill period at the point information on the award of the contract is communicated to all bidders. The standstill period provides time for unsuccessful bidders to challenge the award decision before the contract is entered into.

The Utilities Contracts Regulations 2016 (as amended) provide for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or are at risk of harm by a breach of the rules to take action in the High Court (Northern Ireland).
